<<<<<<< HEAD
The description of a plain instrument that with much ease and exactness will discover the situation of any vertical plane, howsoever inclining, reclining, or declining and how to draw a dyal upon any such plane or upon the face of any vertical body, how irregular soever : together with several other things requisite to the art of dyaling / by A. M. Martindale, Adam, 1623-1686.
14 p., [1] leaf of plates : ill.
Printed for J. Coniers, London : 1668.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
=======
The description of a plain instrument that with much ease and exactness will discover the situation of any vertical plane, howsoever inclining, reclining, or declining and how to draw a dyal upon any such plane or upon the face of any vertical body, how irregular soever : together with several other things requisite to the art of dyaling / by A. M. Martindale, Adam, 1623-1686.
14 p., [1] leaf of plates : ill.
Printed for J. Coniers, London : 1668.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
J. Coniers
